raw_body:
Embrace your inner software developer
The post Reducing Time to Value for Data Science Projects: Part 4 appeared first on Towards Data Science.
speedrun: The article emphasizes the importance of adopting software development practices in data science projects to enhance efficiency and reduce time to value. By integrating coding standards, version control, and collaborative tools, data scientists can streamline workflows and deliver insights faster, which is crucial in today's fast-paced business environment.
why_it_matters: Implementing software development practices in data science can significantly shorten project timelines, enabling businesses to respond quickly to market changes and customer needs.
This approach fosters collaboration among data scientists and developers, leading to higher quality outputs and more innovative solutions, ultimately driving competitive advantage.

lenses.eli12: The article talks about how data scientists can work better by using software development tools and methods. This is cool because it helps them finish projects faster and make better decisions. For regular people, this means businesses can provide quicker solutions and improve services.
lenses.pm: Data scientists and organizations looking to enhance their project efficiency will benefit from this approach. It addresses common issues like slow delivery and poor collaboration. By adopting these practices, companies can gain a competitive edge and reduce risks associated with project delays.
lenses.engineer: The article advocates for a technical shift towards software development methodologies in data science, focusing on tools like version control and automated testing. This architecture promotes better code quality and collaboration but may require data scientists to upskill in software practices, which could be a barrier for some.
